alert.note: Alert for North St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 9:12PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern St. Louis and northwestern Lake Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 912 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 18 miles northwest of Basswood Lake, to Ely, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fall Lake around 930 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Basswood Lake and Snowbank Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Minnesota. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northeastern Minnesota.
